title: "U BANNED KAI'SA, TIME TO TROLL" 4 games in a row...
body: Stop this shit. If the champion you want to play gets banned by a teammate that's no excuse to purposely throw the game and ruin it for everyone

If they were going to pick kai sa in ranked their intent was to troll anyway, didnt change anything.

So you have no respect for your teams decision to play Kai'Sa but you expect them to behave perfectly....that's Int-eresting.

All i can see is trolls on both sides. If I wanted to play Kai'Sa and some self-righteous douchebag bans her in a normal game I would just dodge or play something that is completely off-meta if I am in the mood but I would still try to win. I don't even ban champions in normals...at all. In ranked only sometimes, but only depending on the match-up, new champions are not a concern. Banning new champions is for insecure losers tbh.

PS: and I know what some of you will say "But... QQ they ruin games QQ, new Kai'Sa players are the reason that I can't climb."
No they are not, you are just a loser. Statistically the Kai'Sa players even out on both sides, you get free wins and losses 50/50 but at least you can experience the new champion and explore the strengths and weaknesses. If a Kai'Sa player is really too bad, it's only bad for them because they will 100% drop, you won't.... unless you are just a loser.

But oh wait I know what are you gonna say now "if I ban Kai'Sa on my team, there can still be Kai'Sa players on the enemy team so it helps me win more" 
Well yes, but if you rely on that for winning games you are still just a loser.

In response to that, I feel like banning a champion that a teammate wants to play is also trolling. 

While trolling because your champion got banned is unacceptable, the person who banned the champion themselves isn't making the game better either. They're ruining the game for that one teammate, which is extremely rude.

Let people play what they want to play, even if it's a new champion. Banning a champion because "you don't want to deal with it" is basically saying "I don't want to get better at the game and adapt." I want to learn how to play as/with Kai'Sa, but I can't when my team straight up thinks that they know best.

I feel that Riot should rethink their  opinion about allowing new champions to be played in Ranked.I as well do not wish to allow players playing new champions 1-2 days after their release.

It gives an awful experience and results into feeding most of the times.More awful is that even if we report them,they are just considered bad players and do not get punished  even if they really give up on the game or brake our balls to FF(saw that countless times).

While it's true that players NEED to play them to learn,in ranked it is truly awful and encourages bad manners or even trolling the game because someone didn't get to play the X new released champion.If you ban that champion you get reported for provoking your teammate and results into games being destroyed intentionally by that dude that got tilted.
